titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network Records TAM.581
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Daniel Michelson

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-16T12:03-0400

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network Records

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: The Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network, formerly the Bronx Teen Pregnancy Network, was established in 1983. The Network functioned as a self-selected coalition of organizations, institutions, individuals. This collection includes materials related to the Network's activities and programs that provided education, support, and guidance to teenagers in the Bronx, particularly on the topics of pregnancy and sexually-transmitted diseases. There is also a substantial amount of material pertaining to fundraising.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@library.nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network are held by the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which the Network holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network Records; TAM 581; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated in 1996 by Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network's Executive Director Yvonne Cook. The accession number 2011.062 is associated with this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the records of the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network from its founding in 1983 to its closure in 1996. The largest portion of the collection relates to the organization's unceasing search for funds (contracts, grants, proposals, and related material). However, there is also significant coverage of the Network's activities and programs that provided education, support, and guidance to teenagers in the Bronx, particularly on the topics of pregnancy and sexually-transmitted diseases. The files of executive director Agnes Cooper Dennis are especially well-represented, as is the Better Bronx for Youth program.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network, formerly the Bronx Teen Pregnancy Network, was established in February, 1983, as a result of the large number of teen pregnancies in the area. The Network functioned as a self-selected coalition of organizations, institutions, individuals, whose primary objectives were: the provision of information and referrals, identification of gaps in services, establishing a linkage system which would expedite appropriate and effective referrals and serve as a forum for resource sharing and joint planning and activities. The idea came from a group of social workers who decided to set up a Network in each of the five boroughs. The Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network was the last one to survive.

The mission of the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network was to promote communication, networking, coalition-building and support among service providers and youth; and serve as a resource for the provision of education, cultural enrichment, research, technical assistance in support of service needs of young adults. Information and referrals, resource sharing, delivery and coordination of services, education, training, and advocacy are major goals of the Network. They had a quarterly newsletter that was tied to the information given at the Network meetings.
The Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network closed in January 1996 because of lack of funding.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.

Committees, Subject Files, Grant Application, Assistance Rendered and Referrals Made (records with full name or address of clients destroyed for privacy reasons), Files on Related Organizations
Subject Files, Memos, Correspondence, and Proposals
Staff Meetings, Outgoing Correspondence, Finances, Committees, Quarterly Reports, Agenda for Children Tomorrow (ACT) Proposal
Staff Meetings, Memos, Fundraising, ACT Proposal, Correspondence, Citywide Teen Pregnancy Network Planning
Citywide Teen Pregnancy Network Planning, Project Proposals, United Way Community Achievement Project in the Schools (CAPS)
Grant and Project Proposals, Committees, Staff Meetings, Files on Related Organizations (especially the other NYC teen pregnancy networks)
Citywide Teen Pregnancy Network Planning, Youth Leadership/Mentorship Program, Subject Files
Better Bronx for Youth Project Files, Staff Meetings, and Finances`

Committees, Finances, Student Surveys, Youth Bureau Proposal and Reports, and Material for Newsletter

Audio Cassettes of Meetings and Events and Fifty-one floppy disks (5 1/4'') of Contracts and Other Materials
